titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: The weather continues very cold. I wrote many letters, & was interviewed by several visitors. Thus the morning slipped away.
After lunch Streeter took me for a walk

along the river bank. I was delighted with the beauty of the scene, & the view of the cathedral tower was most beautiful. On my return I wrote more letters, and then went to the Palace, & arranged books until dinner time.
